required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Fluticasone Furoate Nasal Spray Versus Oral Fexofenadine
clinical_study.official_title: A Comparison of Fluticasone Furoate Nasal Spray Versus Oral Fexofenadine in the Treatment of Seasonal Allergic Rhinitis

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of the study is to compare nighttime symptom relief of fluticasone furoate nasal spray versus oral fexofenadine

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in the Nighttime Symptom Score (NSS)
primary_outcome.description: Questions include: 1. Nasal congestion on awakening (Score: 0=none, 1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe); 2. Difficulty going to sleep (Score: 0=not at all, 1=little, 2=moderately, 3=very); 3. Nighttime awakenings (Score: 0=not at all, 1=once, 2=more than once, 3=felt like awake all night). The sum of the ratings for the three items comprises the NSS.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Nighttime Reflective Total Nasal Symptom Score (N-rTNSS)
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects assessed four nasal symptoms (rhinorrhea, nasal congestion, nasal itching, and sneezing). The sum of the four nasal symptoms comprised the total nasal symptom score (TNSS). Reflective rating represented symptoms over preceding 12 hours. Scores: 0=symptoms not present, 1=mild severity, 2=moderate severity, 3=severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Daytime Reflective Total Nasal Symptom Score (D-rTNSS)
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects assessed four nasal symptoms (rhinorrhea, nasal congestion, nasal itching, and sneezing). The sum of the four nasal symptoms comprised the total nasal symptom score (TNSS). Reflective rating represented symptoms over preceding 12 hours. Scores: 0=symptoms not present, 1=mild severity, 2=moderate severity, 3=severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in 24 Hour Reflective Total Nasal Symptom Score (24 Hour rTNSS)
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects assessed four nasal symptoms (rhinorrhea, nasal congestion, nasal itching, and sneezing). The sum of the four nasal symptoms comprised the total nasal symptom score (TNSS).Reflective rating represented symptoms over preceding 12 hours. Scores: 0=symptoms not present, 1=mild severity, 2=moderate severity, 3=severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Nighttime Reflective Total Ocular Symptom Score (N-rTOSS)
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects assessed three ocular symptoms (itching/ burning eyes, tearing/watering eyes, and eye redness). The sum of the 3 ocular symptoms comprised the total ocular symptom score (TOSS). Reflective rating represented symptoms over preceding 12 hours. Scores: 0=symptoms not present, 1=mild severity, 2=moderate severity, 3=severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Daytime Reflective Total Ocular Symptom Score (D-rTOSS)
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects assessed three ocular symptoms (itching/ burning eyes, tearing/watering eyes, and eye redness). The sum of the 3 ocular symptoms comprised the total ocular symptom score (TOSS). Reflective rating represented symptoms over preceding 12 hours. Scores: 0=symptoms not present, 1=mild severity, 2=moderate severity, 3=severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in 24 Hour Reflective Total Ocular Symptoms Score (rTOSS)
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects assessed three ocular symptoms (itching/ burning eyes, tearing/watering eyes, and eye redness). The sum of the 3 ocular symptoms comprised the total ocular symptom score (TOSS). Reflective rating represented symptoms over preceding 12 hours. Scores: 0=symptoms not present, 1=mild severity, 2=moderate severity, 3=severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Pre-Dose Instantaneous Total Nasal Symptom Score (iTNSS)
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects assessed four nasal symptoms (rhinorrhea, nasal congestion, nasal itching, and sneezing). The sum of the four nasal symptoms comprised the total nasal symptom score (TNSS).Instantaneous rating represented symptoms at the time of the assessment. Scores: 0=symptoms not present, 1=mild severity, 2=moderate severity, 3=severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Pre-Dose Instantaneous Total Ocular Symptom Score (iTOSS)
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects assessed three ocular symptoms (itching/ burning eyes, tearing/watering eyes, and eye redness). The sum of the four ocular symptoms comprised the total nasal symptom score (TOSS).Instantaneous rating represented symptoms at the time of the assessment. Scores: 0=symptoms not present, 1=mild severity, 2=moderate severity, 3=severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Morning Peak Nasal Inspiratory Flow (PNIF)
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects used a portable hand-held inspiratory flow meter to measure and record PNIF in the morning prior to taking the study medication. Three measurements were taken and the highest measurement was recorded in the electronic diary. A positive change signifies improved nasal air flow.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Evening Peak Nasal Inspiratory Flow (PNIF)
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects used a portable hand-held inspiratory flow meter to measure and record PNIF in the evening. Three measurements were taken and the highest measurement was recorded in the electronic diary. A positive change signifies improved nasal air flow.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline at Day 15 for Nocturnal Rhinoconjunctivitis Quality of Life Questionnaire (NRQLQ)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Day 15 or if Early Withdrawal Day
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects completed the 16-item Nocturnal Rhinoconjunctivitis Quality of Life Questionnaire (NRQLQ)to assess nocturnal rhinitis-related quality of life. The NRQLQ measures the functional problems most troublesome to patients with nocturnal allergy symptoms. Each question scored from 0-6 with higher scores indicating more nocturnal impairment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Informed consent
- Otherwise healthy outpatient with mountain cedar allergy
- Male or eligible female Females of childbearing potential must commit to the consistent and correct use of an acceptable method of birth control
- Age 12 years or older at Visit 2
- Diagnosis of seasonal allergic rhinitis (SAR) to mountain cedar
- Adequate exposure to mountain cedar pollen
- Ability to comply with study procedures
- Literate
Exclusion criteria:
- Significant concomitant medical conditions
- Use of intranasal corticosteroids within four weeks prior to Visit 1; use of inhaled, oral, intramuscular, intravenous, ocular, and/or dermatological corticosteroid (with the exception of hydrocortisone cream/ointment, 1% or less) within eight weeks prior to Visit 1.
- Use of other allergy medications within specific timeframes relative to Visit 1
- Use of other medications that may affect allergic rhinitis or its symptoms
- Use of immunosuppressive medications eight weeks prior to screening and during the study
- Immunotherapy patients who are not stable on current dose
- Use of any medications that significantly alters the pharmacokinetics of fluticasone furoate or fexofenadine
- Allergy/Intolerance to corticosteroids, antihistamines, or any excipients in the two products
- Use of contact lenses
- Recent clinical trial/experimental medication experience within 30 days of Visit 1
- Subject previously failed the 21-day screen period or failed to complete the treatment period
- Positive or inconclusive pregnancy test or female who is breastfeeding
- Employee or relative affiliation with investigational site
- Current tobacco use
- Active chickenpox or measles or exposure in the last 3 weeks

link.description: Researchers can use this site to request access to anonymised patient level data and/or supporting documents from clinical studies to conduct further research.

patient_data.ipd_description: Patient-level data for this study will be made available through www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com following the timelines and process described on this site.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Outside pollen area more than 48 hours

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in the Nighttime Symptom Score (NSS)
outcome.description: Questions include: 1. Nasal congestion on awakening (Score: 0=none, 1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe); 2. Difficulty going to sleep (Score: 0=not at all, 1=little, 2=moderately, 3=very); 3. Nighttime awakenings (Score: 0=not at all, 1=once, 2=more than once, 3=felt like awake all night). The sum of the ratings for the three items comprises the NSS.
outcome.population: One analysis population was defined for this study, the Intent-to-Treat population. . The Intent-to-Treat (ITT) population included all subjects randomized to double-blind treatment. This population formed the basis for all summaries of demographic, background, efficacy, and safety data.

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline in the Nighttime Symptom Score (NSS)
measure.description: Questions include: 1. Nasal congestion on awakening (Score: 0=none, 1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe); 2. Difficulty going to sleep (Score: 0=not at all, 1=little, 2=moderately, 3=very); 3. Nighttime awakenings (Score: 0=not at all, 1=once, 2=more than once, 3=felt like awake all night). The sum of the ratings for the three items comprises the NSS.
measure.population: One analysis population was defined for this study, the Intent-to-Treat population. . The Intent-to-Treat (ITT) population included all subjects randomized to double-blind treatment. This population formed the basis for all summaries of demographic, background, efficacy, and safety data.

analysis.groups_desc: The primary efficacy measure, mean change from baseline over the two-week treatment period in NSS compared between fluticasone furoate and fexofenadine, was assessed at a significance level of α=0.05. If the null hypothesis of this comparison was rejected, then the secondary measures were subject to hypothesis testing. The study was powered at 90%.
analysis.p_value_desc: Symptom scores were grouped in 3 families: nasal, ocular, instantaneous. Within each family, results of hypothesis tests were adjusted using Hochberg’s method.
analysis.method_desc: No other strata or covariates, other than investigator, were defined.
analysis.estimate_desc: Mean Difference = Mean Change in Fluticasone Furoate - Mean Change in Fexofenadine
Mean Difference = Mean Change in Fluticasone Furoate - Mean Change in Placebo
Mean Difference = Mean Change in Fexofenadine - Mean Change in Placebo

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Morning Peak Nasal Inspiratory Flow (PNIF)
outcome.description: Subjects used a portable hand-held inspiratory flow meter to measure and record PNIF in the morning prior to taking the study medication. Three measurements were taken and the highest measurement was recorded in the electronic diary. A positive change signifies improved nasal air flow.
outcome.population: Two subjects in the placebo group & three in the FFNS group recorded no data during the two-week treatment period.

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Morning Peak Nasal Inspiratory Flow (PNIF)
measure.description: Subjects used a portable hand-held inspiratory flow meter to measure and record PNIF in the morning prior to taking the study medication. Three measurements were taken and the highest measurement was recorded in the electronic diary. A positive change signifies improved nasal air flow.
measure.population: Two subjects in the placebo group & three in the FFNS group recorded no data during the two-week treatment period.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Evening Peak Nasal Inspiratory Flow (PNIF)
outcome.description: Subjects used a portable hand-held inspiratory flow meter to measure and record PNIF in the evening. Three measurements were taken and the highest measurement was recorded in the electronic diary. A positive change signifies improved nasal air flow.
outcome.population: Two subjects in the placebo group & two in the FFNS group recorded no data during the two-week treatment period.

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Evening Peak Nasal Inspiratory Flow (PNIF)

measure.population: Two subjects in the placebo group & two in the FFNS group recorded no data during the two-week treatment period.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline at Day 15 for Nocturnal Rhinoconjunctivitis Quality of Life Questionnaire (NRQLQ)
outcome.description: Subjects completed the 16-item Nocturnal Rhinoconjunctivitis Quality of Life Questionnaire (NRQLQ)to assess nocturnal rhinitis-related quality of life. The NRQLQ measures the functional problems most troublesome to patients with nocturnal allergy symptoms. Each question scored from 0-6 with higher scores indicating more nocturnal impairment.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Day 15 or if Early Withdrawal Day
outcome.population: Ten placebo subjects, six FFNS subjects, and four fexofenadine subjects had no overall NRQLQ score at endpoint, indicating either a missing score for one or more of the NRQLQ domains, a missing baseline score, or both. One additional FFNS patient had no on-treatment NRQLQ data.

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline at Day 15 for Nocturnal Rhinoconjunctivitis Quality of Life Questionnaire (NRQLQ)
measure.description: Subjects completed the 16-item Nocturnal Rhinoconjunctivitis Quality of Life Questionnaire (NRQLQ)to assess nocturnal rhinitis-related quality of life. The NRQLQ measures the functional problems most troublesome to patients with nocturnal allergy symptoms. Each question scored from 0-6 with higher scores indicating more nocturnal impairment.
measure.population: Ten placebo subjects, six FFNS subjects, and four fexofenadine subjects had no overall NRQLQ score at endpoint, indicating either a missing score for one or more of the NRQLQ domains, a missing baseline score, or both. One additional FFNS patient had no on-treatment NRQLQ data.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centres of a multi-centre trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
